intro: Arachnorchis intuta, commonly known as the golden spider orchid, is an endemic Australian plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its striking yellow and green flowers, which resemble small spiders, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions of Western Australia. It has a slender, hairy stem and produces small, delicate leaves. Arachnorchis intuta is a rare and protected species, often found in specific microhabitats where it thrives in limited sunlight and well-drained conditions.
